ratings.comment: Loved Kyle, super funny and made stats interesting somehow. I'm in no way a math person but his passion for stats made it one of my most enjoyable classes. Also young and v cute.

Kyle was an amazing teacher. He really taught things in a way that made it easy to understand. Definitely attend lectures and discussions as they really help you understand the material. Plus there is no Friday lecture. You need the textbook to do homework.

Kyle is such a bro. If you get the opportunity to take his class thank your lucky stars because he's the coolest instructor you'll have at UW. Loved his humor and how he ran his lectures. Cheat sheets allowed on tests and questions are fairly straightforward. Lots of partial credit on free response.
Best Professor.  If you want someone who writes fair exams that reflect the material covered in class, then I highly recommend him.

Kyle is a grad-student, therefore he knows what its like to have to deal with bad professors. He a no-nonsense lecturer, he gets his points across clearly and effectively without going off on pointless rants. Tests were extremely fair.  Would recommend taking this class with Kyle. He is super nice guy outside of class too and very approachable

I wasn't sure how Stats301 would go for me when I first started taking it.  It actually turned out to be pretty great!  Kyle is a hilarious professor and knows how to get the material across to the students in a way that keeps our interest.

Ended lecture with "I'd appreciate if you wrote something about me on rate my professor because my parents still don't believe I did this". This guy gets 1010 for humor. Very clear, wouldn't recommend taking stats with anyone else!
